title: Department of Defense support for 2023 film "The Covenant"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2023 movie "The Covenant," directed by Guy Ritchie. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD support for "The Covenant." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Covenant," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (NY DFS)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of complaints to the Department of Financial Services regarding insurance and/or health care providers from 2015 to 2025 containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” or “reimbursed,” along with  “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via DFS’s Healthcare Provider Complaint Form. I wish to receive the records in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan

title: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (NY AG)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of consumer complaints from 2015 to 2025 about healthcare providers, doctors, hospitals, or surgical centers containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” “reimbursed,” “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via the NY Attorney General’s Health Care Complaint Form. I wish to receive the records in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan
